title: Smaller Muni Issuers Face Some of the Biggest Climate Risks
text:
The threats posed by a changing climate spell trouble for a number of small municipal-bond issuers, including some in South Carolina, Kentucky, and Texas.

Muni investors face long-term risks in the $3.8 trillion market, Barron’s wrote recently, because climate change raises an issuer’s credit risk by damaging its assets and tax base.
